sections.1_story: Imagine filling a water tank with multiple pipes. Some pipes fill the tank, while others drain it. Pipes & Cisterns problems help us calculate how long it takes to fill or empty tanks when pipes work together or against each other.
2_definitions: ğŸ’¡ Pipe: A channel that fills or empties a tank.
ğŸ’¡ Inlet: A pipe that fills the tank.
ğŸ’¡ Outlet: A pipe that empties the tank.
ğŸ’¡ Cistern: A tank or reservoir.
ğŸ’¡ Filling Rate: Amount of tank filled per unit time.
ğŸ’¡ Emptying Rate: Amount of tank emptied per unit time.
ğŸ’¡ Net Rate: Combined effect of all pipes working together.
ğŸ’¡ Time to Fill: Time taken to fill the tank completely.
ğŸ’¡ Time to Empty: Time taken to empty the tank completely.
ğŸ’¡ Partial Work: Work done by pipes in a given time.
3_formula_bank: ğŸ§® If a pipe fills in n hours, 1 hour's work = 1/n
ğŸ§® If a pipe empties in m hours, 1 hour's work = -1/m
ğŸ§® Net rate = sum of all filling and emptying rates
ğŸ§® Time to fill = 1 / (total net rate)
ğŸ§® If two pipes fill in n and m hours: 1/n + 1/m per hour
ğŸ§® If one fills and one empties: 1/n - 1/m per hour
ğŸ§® If tank has leak: Subtract leak's rate from filling rate
ğŸ§® If part of tank is already filled: Subtract from total
ğŸ§® If pipes open/close at different times: Calculate work in intervals
4_micro_examples: Pipe A fills in 6 hrs. 1 hr's work = 1/6
Pipe B empties in 8 hrs. 1 hr's work = -1/8
A and B together: 1/6 - 1/8 = 1/24 per hr
If A fills in 4 hrs, B in 5 hrs: 1/4 + 1/5 = 9/20 per hr
If C leaks and empties in 10 hrs: 1/10 per hr (negative)
If tank is half full, fill remaining half only
If A fills in 3 hrs, B empties in 6 hrs: 1/3 - 1/6 = 1/6 per hr
If 2 pipes fill in 2 and 3 hrs: 1/2 + 1/3 = 5/6 per hr
If A fills in 12 hrs, B empties in 24 hrs: 1/12 - 1/24 = 1/24 per hr
If pipe is closed after some time, calculate work done till then

5_exam_examples.question: Pipe A fills a tank in 8 hours, B empties in 12 hours. How long to fill?
Two pipes fill a tank in 6 and 9 hours. How long together?
A fills in 5 hrs, B empties in 10 hrs. How long to fill?
A fills in 4 hrs, B fills in 6 hrs. How long together?
A fills in 8 hrs, B empties in 16 hrs. How long to fill?
A fills in 3 hrs, B fills in 4 hrs, C empties in 12 hrs. How long to fill?
If a tank is half full and pipe fills in 6 hrs, how long to fill completely?
solution_steps: Half tank left, so time = 6/2 = 3 hours

5_exam_examples.question: A fills in 10 hrs, B fills in 15 hrs. How long together?
A fills in 7 hrs, B empties in 21 hrs. How long to fill?
If pipe is closed after 2 hours, how much tank is filled? (A fills in 8 hrs)
